description:

title: Police Officer

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Portrait and role symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: This police officer wears a blue hat, which features¬†a gold badge or shield in the middle. The gender of this emoji is not specified, but is http://emojipedia.org/police-officer/
emoji_net_data.name: police officer

bn:00105848a: Having its basis in the law.
Established by or founded upon law or official or accepted rules

bn:00098827a: Possessing or displaying courage; able to face and deal with danger or fear without flinching- Herman Melville- William Wordsworth
Strong in the face of fear.
Of a person, displaying or possessing courage.
Strong in the face of fear; courageous.

bn:00097799a: Having authority or ascendancy or influence
Arising or originating from a figure of authority
Originating from a figure of authority.

bn:00091483v: Maintain the security of by carrying out a patrol

bn:00082712v: Ensure observance of laws and rules;
Ensure observance of laws and rules.

bn:00092103v: Shield from danger, injury, destruction, or damage
To prevent against danger, injury, destruction, or damage.

bn:00091144v: Direct or command as an officer

bn:00054972n: Any person in the armed services who holds a position of authority or command
Any person in the armed services who holds a position of authority or command.
An officer is a member of an armed force or uniformed service who holds a position of authority.
Member of an armed force or uniformed service who holds a position of authority

bn:00022026n: A police force is a constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law, protect property, and limit civil disorder.
A civil force granted the legal authority to enforce the law and maintain public order.
Constabulary may have several definitions: A civil, non-paramilitary force consisting of police officers called constables.
Branch of the government which is charged with the preservation of public order, the promotion of public health and safety, and the prevention, detection, and punishment of crimes.
The force of policemen and officers
Constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law
An organisation that enforces the law.
With `old bill' as a slang term in the UK

bn:00048655n: The collection of rules imposed by authority
System of rules and guidelines, generally backed by governmental authority
Body of rules from the legislative authority.
Law is, generally, a system of rules which are enforced through social institutions to govern behavior.
A body of rules of action or conduct prescribed by a legislative authority, and having binding legal force.
The body of rules and standards issued by a government, or to be applied by courts and similar authorities.
Law is a term referring to sociological or scientific norms, or systems and expressions based upon them.

bn:00058698n: A member of a police force
A member of a police force, especially one who is male.
An officer of a law enforcement agency.
A police officer is a warranted employee of a police force.
A police officer, especially a junior one who does patrol instead of detection or supervising other policemen.
A police officer or prison guard.
Warranted employee of a police force
An officer in a law enforcement agency.

bn:00946750n: The act of depriving a person of his or her liberty usually in relation to the purported investigation or prevention of crime and presenting to a procedure as part of the criminal justice system.
Act of arresting a criminal, suspect etc.
The action of police or other authority to apprehend and take under guard a person who is suspected of committing a crime
The act of arresting a criminal, suspect etc.

An arrest is the act of depriving a person of their liberty usually in relation to the purported investigation or prevention of crime and presenting to a procedure as part of the criminal justice system.

bn:00061160n: Member of a military force charged with peacekeeping duties.
A member of a military force charged with peacekeeping duties in a troublespot.
A member of a military force that is assigned (often with international sanction) to preserve peace in a trouble area

bn:00001533n: Sexual maturity is the age or stage when an organism can reproduce.
The age or stage when an organism can reproduce
A man is a male human.
An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
A human member of the masculine sex or gender.
An adult person who is male (as opposed to a woman)
